## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been trying to learn more about PBaaS chains and how they interact with the Verus daemon. Can you tell me how they operate independently of the Verus daemon?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, all PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, which means they don't operate independently of it. They can be part of the Verus community and contribute to improving the daemon. By doing so, they get a complete, multi-currency, VerusID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. Would you like to know more about how PBaaS chains work with the Verus daemon?

**User:**
That makes sense. I had another question, can a VerusID owner define basket currencies with no reserves backing the currency?

**AI Assistant:**
No, a VerusID owner can define basket currencies with one or more reserves backing the currency, at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. This ensures that the basket currency is always backed by some amount of reserve currency. Does that clarify things for you?

**User:**
I've been reading about DeFi protocols and I had a question about how Verus DeFi protocol addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running. I thought it did so by giving miners and stakers a portion of the block reward?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, that's not how Verus DeFi protocol addresses MEV and front-running. Instead, it ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular basket currency, and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers. This approach helps to mitigate the issues of MEV and front-running in a different way. Would you like me to explain more about how Verus DeFi protocol addresses these issues?
How do PBaaS chains operate independently of the Verus daemon?

Actually, all PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, which means they don't operate independently of it. They can be part of the Verus community and contribute to improving the daemon. By doing so, they get a complete, multi-currency, VerusID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.

All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, VerusID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.## DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
Any VerusID owner may define basket currencies, with one or more reserves backing the currency, at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing.The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular basket currency, and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi basket currencies directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.## Bridge converter launches
Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain.Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other 100% asset backed or partially asset backed basket currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.

No, a VerusID owner can define basket currencies with one or more reserves backing the currency, at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing.

How do Verus DeFi protocol address the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running by giving miners and stakers a portion of the block reward?

The Verus DeFi protocol doesn't address the problems of MEV and front-running by giving miners and stakers a portion of the block reward. Instead, it ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular basket currency, and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers.
